official-title.#text:
To amend the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 to designate high priority
			 corridors on the National Highway System in the State of North Carolina,
			 and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Military Corridor Transportation Improvement Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Military Corridor Transportation Improvement Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: High priority corridors on National Highway System

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1105(c) of the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991/s:1105/ss:c

text.#text:
United States Route 117/Interstate Route 795 from United States Route 70 in Goldsboro, Wayne
			 County, North Carolina, to Interstate Route 40 west of Faison, Sampson
			 County, North Carolina.

United States Route 70 from its intersection with Interstate Route 40 in Garner, Wake County, North
			 Carolina, to the Port at Morehead City, Carteret County, North Carolina.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended in the first sentence by striking

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1105(e)(5)(A) of the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991/s:1105/ss:e/p:5/sp:A

header.#text: Inclusion of certain route segments on Interstate System

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5561 IH: Military Corridor Transportation Improvement Act of 2014
